thread.title: Cops: Man dead after motorcycle collides with school bus in Elgin - Elgin Courier-News
thread.title_full: Cops: Man dead after motorcycle collides with school bus in Elgin - Elgin Courier-News

author: Janelle Walker
title: Cops: Man dead after motorcycle collides with school bus in Elgin - Elgin Courier-News
text:
An 18-year-old man was killed Wednesday morning after his motorcycle collided with an Elgin School District U46 bus, officials said.
There were no children on the bus at the time.
According to police, the motorcycle driver reportedly ran through the stop light at Center and Chicago streets when the accident occurred.
Elgin police and fire departments were called to the busy downtown intersection at about 10:55 a.m., officials said. The southbound motorcyclist struck the school bus that was eastbound on Chicago Street, according to the preliminary police investigation, officials said.
The motorcyclist was taken to Presence St. Joseph Hospital, where he was pronounced dead, officials said. His identity is being withheld pending notification of relatives, and an autopsy will be conducted by the Kane County coroner, officials added.
The 54-year-old male driver of the school bus was not injured in the incident, officials said.
The Chicago and Center street intersection remained closed while the Elgin Police Department Traffic Unit investigated the crash. Anyone with information pertinent to the crash is encouraged to call 847-289-2661.
Janelle Walker is a freelance reporter for The Courier-News.
